intro: Stellaria jamesiana, commonly known as the James's starwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants characterized by their showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its small, star-shaped white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, rounded fruits. Stellaria jamesiana is often found in regions with cool, temperate climates and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-rich soils.
